1、李云涛等编著，《纳米生物医学光电子学前沿》，北京：科学出版社，2013。
2、孙进等译，《纳米粒给药系统》，北京：科学出版社，2011。
3、王琛等编著，《纳米科学与技术：纳米科技创新方法研究》，北京：科学出版社，2012.
4、何丹农等编著，《材料与工程领域应用纳米技术研究报告 : 2010-2020 》，北京：科学出版社。

1、李云涛等编著，《纳米生物医学光电子学前沿》，北京：科学出版社，2013。
2、孙进等译，《纳米粒给药系统》，北京：科学出版社，2011。
3、王琛等编著，《纳米科学与技术：纳米科技创新方法研究》，北京：科学出版社，2012.
4、何丹农等编著，《材料与工程领域应用纳米技术研究报告 : 2010-2020 》，北京：科学出版社。

纳米技术已经全面融入到人们的日常生活中，并已成为国家的战略新兴产业和基础研究高地，然而该学科的科普工作却并不理想。通过本课程的学习可以使学生对纳米技术的基本特点、应用、优势及潜在的危害等有一定的了解，提高学生基本的科学素养，开阔学生的知识面，学会辨别真实的纳米科学，进而提高其整体素质。通过本课程的学习，了解什么是纳米技术；了解纳米物质的基本性质、基本原理和常用制备方法；熟悉纳米技术在药学领域的应用；了解纳米技术在食品领域的应用；了解纳米技术在化妆品中的应用；了解纳米技术在工程材料方面的应用；了解纳米技术在其他领域的应用。使本科生对纳米技术有较为全面的认识，提高本科生对科学前沿领域的了解，并对其从事相关研究奠定基础。

1、概论、纳米技术的基本原理。2、纳米技术在药学领域的应用。3、纳米技术在食品领域的应用。4、纳米技术在化妆品中的应用。5、纳米技术在工程材料中的应用。
6、纳米技术在其他领域的应用。
纳米靶向系统：新材料与新策略
Nanoparticulated Delivery Systems: Novel Materials and Strategies
《脑靶向递药系统》，《靶向治疗分子基础与靶向药物设计》\x07
系统地学习和掌握新型靶向递药系统的基本原理、策略及其在疾病治疗中的应用。提高学生在药剂前沿领域的理论基础，培养学生的基本科研素质，并使学生具有发现问题、分析问题和解决问题的初步能力，为学生从事药物新剂型研发及进一步深造学习奠定基础。

1.《新版中日交流标准日本语》，人民教育出版社，2005年。
2.《实用药学日语》中国医药科技出版社，2014年。
3.《医学日语阅读》人民军医出版社，2003年

本课程通过对学生进行日语的读、写、译的基本训练，使学生掌握日语的基础知识和基本技能，使之具有初步的日语运用能力、基本的日语专业文献及专著的阅读能力，为今后的科学研究工作打下语言基础，课程的具体内容包括：
1.	日语发音基础（平假名、片假名、发音）
2.	日语语法基础（基本句型和惯用句型）
3.	日语语言习惯
4.	文献阅读训练（阅读理解、专业词汇）

1）通过本课程的学习，使学生总览疾病史与药物发现史的全貌，并熟悉了解重要药物的发现历史；
2）通过对药物发现史的学习，能认识和评价新药发现和与之对应的疾病的攻克对于人类历史的影响和价值；
3）通过结合社会热点问题，引起学生的思考，培养学生的理性思维

古往今来，人类从未停止与疾病的斗争。一种新的药物和治疗方法的发现不仅能挽救成千上万的生命，还往往对人类社会、经济的各个层面产生巨大的影响，从而改变人类的历史。本课程纵览中西医学史，通过撷取药物发现史上具有里程碑意义的伟大药物的发现之路，为学生揭示科学发现的偶然与必然，激发学生对于未知领域的探索欲并拓展其对于科学研究的兴趣；通过讲述各治疗领域重磅炸弹级药物的发现者及其研究历程中的奇闻异事，将诺贝尔医学及生理学奖获得者的研究工作以深入浅出的方式为学生展现，揭示科学发现的哲学观_
Special Topics in Pharmaceutical Research - An Introductory Course for Future Pharmacists
Martin's Physical Pharmacy and Pharmaceutical Sciences

The first part of the course will provide students an overall understanding of the state of the art for controlled drug delivery with a particular focus on controlled and sustained formulations. The second part of the course will introduce fun stories related to drug discovery with a focus on natural products.
Drug Discovery and Therapeutics in the 21st Century: Novel Paradigms and Applications
Drug Discovery and Therapeutics in the 21st Century: Novel Paradigms and Applications

Drug discovery is an expensive and time-consuming process. Established pharmacological principles provide the framework for the development of relevant cellular assay platforms through which a collection of chemicals are screened to identify lead compounds for subsequent development into drugs for clinical use. However, latest research has yielded a number of novel paradigms that represent a significant departure from traditional understanding of ligand-receptor signalling, which may impact outcomes in drug discovery campaigns. This course will therefore take students through the fundamentals of novel pharmacology, especially those related to receptor pharmacology, including allosterism and allosteric interactions, biased signalling (functional selectivity), receptor dimerisation and G-protein-independent signalling. It will present experimental approaches and state-of-the-art instrumentation used to investigate these concepts and how they are being woven into the drug discovery fabric to improve the prospect of finding disease-modifying therapeutics. As such, significant aspects of pharmacology, pathophysiology, cell and molecular biology, medicinal chemistry, regulatory framework in drug discovery, and methods such as assay development and validation, cellular imaging (fluorescence imaging), high-content and high-throughput screening and in vivo proof-of-concept will be covered.
Career Development and Science Communication in the Current Global Environment
Career Development and Science Communication in the Current Global Environment

This course will therefore discuss how to develop a career in the sciences in general and in the life sciences in particular, right from undergraduate days to the attainment of the career pinnacle. It will emphasise areas such as choice of graduate course and an appropriate institution, the role of supervision and mentoring (including mentor-mentee relationship), undertaking a PhD, conducting postdoctoral research, applying for fellowships, grant writing and management, publishing research (manuscript writing, authorship, etc.), attending conferences and presenting research findings (e.g., orally and by posters), research collaboration and networking, attending an interview for a scientific job, careers in academia, alternative careers (careers in industry, biotech companies, medical writing, patent writing, regulatory industry and administration, etc.). It will also discuss how to achieve an excellent work-life balance.
Comparative Research Methods in Psychology: USA and China
Comparative Research Methods in Psychology: USA and China

This course explains basic procedures of conducting the four (4) key types of research (experimental, survey, naturalistic observation and ethnographic), and ethical issues in conducting psychological research. Discussions and examples of quantitative and qualitative research will be compared and contrasted. The students will have a hands-on opportunity to conduct each of the four types of research, and to analyze the data. A comparison of research procedures commonly used in psychological disciplines in the USA and China will be discussed.

This visual urbanism course takes the city of Chengdu as field laboratory to investigate and visualize the urban culture, social spaces and spatial practices of its rapidly changing urban landscape. The conceptual framework for the course brings together the rich interdisciplinary field of urban studies with the inspiring anthropological practice of visual representation, including photography, film, new media, and other visualizations. The course is designed for students interested in urban space and culture from the perspective of many fields of study, including urban studies, anthropology, sociology, geography, photography, visual arts, architecture, engineering, etc.
A History of Modern Western Medicine: Britain c.1790-1990
A History of Modern Western Medicine: Britain c.1790-1990

An introduction to the major developments in the history of western medicine that takes Britain as a case study from the late eighteen to the late twentieth centuries. The course includes the changing organization and provision of medical care, changes in understanding of disease, the history of ‘the patient’, the emergence and growth of specialization, the history of public health and disease prevention.

Health and health behavior depend crucially on social networks. Both the spread of communicable diseases, such as HIV, and the diffusion of beliefs and practices that shape health behavior, such as dietary risk behavior, can be understood as network-generated health processes, operating over (sometimes very complex and dynamic) social networks. Despite the clear demand, network methods are rarely covered in the standard social-science methods sequences taught to health and health-policy scholars. This class is designed to help bridge the gap between research demand and training. We will provide a four-class series to cover network data collection and management, introduction to network concepts & measures, statistical modeling for networks, software and visualization tools.

Climate change, destruction of habitat and biodiversity and overuse of limited resources are some of the challenges faced by humanity and which threaten our way of life.This course examines the fundamental organizational causes of this failure to live within the limits of our planet. It explores how science can contribute to organizing humanity (social, political, material/economic) to avert system failure and pass through the global sustainability crisis.Historically social, economic and political events and systems have evolved often without conscious direction by people. However the current global situation and the urgency of response requires a conscious approach to the organization of humanity, guided by science. This course outlines some of the principles, which would guide such reorganization.
前沿分析技术在药物分析中的应用
Application of Frontier Analysis in pharmaceutical analysis
通过开设本课程，加深学生对先进分析技术理论的了解，通过案例分析，将理论与实际应用相结合，开阔学生的思维，使学生了解先进分析分析技术的基本原理及相关应用。
系统讲授质谱联用、激光粒度分析仪、X射线衍射、近红外等仪器基本概念、理论基础、基本方法和在药物分析中的实际应用
Intercultural Communication Skills for Professional Development
Intercultural Communication Skills for Professional Development

This module employs a range of self-assessment and interactive exercises designed to develop students' awareness of their own and others’ cultural values.  The course explores how these can create intercultural barriers, and then practises communication techniques designed to achieve more harmonious collaboration.  This module is set in the context of globalisation where so many students aspire to working for international organisations that expect productive, intercultural team-working.   Group presentations therefore constitute the final assessment.
Critical Thinking Skills for the Social Sciences
Critical Thinking Skills for the Social Sciences

This module aims to develop students’ ability to evaluate ideas objectively by considering different viewpoints on any given topic.  This is particularly important in the academic context of the Social Sciences where so many issues are open to debate.  Participants will consider how to assimilate ideas from the module lectures, reading texts and group discussions into a course assignment that forms the final assessment.  This requires them to apply the processes of critical listening, reading, writing and referencing learned during the course.
高等天然药物化学实验
Advanced Experiments for  Chemistry of Medicinal Natural Products
Experiments of Chemistry of Medicinal Natural Products

This course aims to provide students with a comprehensive understanding of the role that nanotechnology will play in pharmacology and pharmaceutical sciences for both diagnostics and therapeutics in the 21th century. This short course will cover how this rapidly developing field will impact human health and the challenges involved. It will start by introducing the concept of nanotechnology, the fundamental physics, chemistry and biology underpinning the modern nano-pharmaceutical sciences. Special emphasis will be given to equip the students with the knowledge of nano-bio interface (how nanomaterials and drugs interact with human blood, cells and tissues). After the discussion of modern technology platforms that are used to characterize nanoparticle-based drug delivery systems, the current application of nanotechnology in pharmaceutical sciences will be explored. All examples of the application of nanomedicine will be taken from current SCI publications. Latest development in the application of nano-pharmaceutical sciences in medicine will be introduced via examples in nano carrier-based drug delivery, cancer nanomedicine, diagnostic imaging, as well as nenoregenerative medicine. Finally, the potential risks of nanotechnology and how to manage them (nanotoxicology) in pharmaceutical science/industry will be discussed. This course is aimed at students majoring in pharmaceutical science, basic medicine as well as clinical medicine. The professor teaching this course is a Clarivate Analytics world Highly Cited Researcher-2017 (in the field of Pharmacology/toxicology). The Highly Cited Researchers are regarded as “The World’s Most Influential Scientific Minds”,

《Fundamentals of Electric Circuits》，作者：Charles K. Alexander & Matthew N.O. Sadiku，出版社：MCGRAW-HILL EDUCATION，2004年；《电路理论基础》，王勇 龙建忠主编，科学出版社，2009年6月
Fundamentals of Electric Circuits, Charles K. Alexander & Matthew N.O. Sadiku, MCGRAW-HILL EDUCATION, 2004; Fundamentals of Electric Circuits Theory, Wangyong、Longjianzghong, Science Press, June.2009

电路理论是电子工程最重要的基础理论课之一，在此基础上发展出电子工程的各个分支学科。电源、电子机械、控制、电子学、通讯以及电子仪器等分支都是基于电路理论而发展起来的。所以电路理论课程是电子工程最重要的课程，也是学生学习电子工程的最好起点。本课程包含三个部分：第一部分介绍直流电路，主要讨论电路基本定律和定理、电路分析的基本方法，以及有源和无源元件；第二部分介绍交流电路，主要讨论相量、正弦稳态分析、交流电源、交流电的有效值以及频率响应；第三部分介绍网络分析知识，对拉普拉斯变换和双口网络分析等内容进行了详细的讨论。通过课程内容的学习，要求学生掌握电路分析的基本理论和方法，能够进行基本电路的分析，为后续专业课的学习打好良好的基础??
《数据结构与算法分析》，Clifford A. Shaffer，电子工业出版社，2002年6月第2版；《计算机软件技术基础》，徐士良编著。清华大学出版社。2007年2月；《数据结构》（C语言版），严蔚敏、吴伟民编著。清华大学出版社。1992年3月第1版。
“A Practical Introduction to Data Structures and Algorithm Analysis”, Clifford A. Shaffer, Publishing House of Electronics industry, Second edition, June, 2002.

数据结构是计算机科学教育中的一门必修课程。这门课程主要是介绍数据结构及其相关操作的算法. 本课程向学生介绍数据结构的基础知识、方法与实用技术。主要内容包括：算法分析、抽象数据类型、数组、表、栈、递归、队列、树、排序树、集合、散列和散列表、查找和排序的算法。通过对本课程的学习，要求学生掌握数据结构的基本概念和知识，并可用计算机语言实现这些数据结构，初步学会应用基本数据结构进行算法设计；掌握查找与排序的一些实用技术。为今后的软件开发工作打下扎实的基础。
